title.narrative: UG-0000372 Learn4AgriBusiness-Heifer Uganda

description.narrative: Learn4Agribusiness is three years (2018-2020), Youth Agribusiness Project is implemented in partnership by EDUKANS and HEIFER in Dokolo district, Uganda focusing on 3 major value chains crops (Maize, Sunflower and Groundnuts) with a total budget of 1.066.851 EUR. Overall goals and objectives of the project L4AB’s overall goal is to improve economic situation of (young) farmers in Dokolo district by bridging the gap between marginalized, unemployed rural youth and the agricultural sector. The project takes a unique approach that marries an integrated approach, combining Edukans’ expertise in market-oriented skills education methods with Heifer’s experience in community-based development of agricultural production systems and inclusive markets. With this approach, underprivileged youth in Dokolo district, North Uganda will directly be enabled to make a decent and sustainable living in agricultural value chains. The projects aim at enabling 3,200 uneducated young people between 18-30 years of age earn decent income to support themselves and families through enhanced effective training on production, processing and marketing practices of the three value chain crops. With these skills youth will be empowered to profitably and inclusively participate in Agricultural practices at different stages of the value chains through agri-business hubs that links them to profitable markets and relevant support functions

transaction.ref: UG-0000372 2019 Edukans KE remaining budget staff and costs 2018 part 1
UG-0000372 outside budget Jan June Heifer UG
UG-0000372 project costs plus reimb Heifer UG

title.narrative: Education and training supported by sustainable partnerships between (global) civil society, government and private sector

description.narrative: Education and training supported by sustainable partnerships between (global) civil society, government and private sector

title.narrative: Number of sustainable partnerships between training providers, private sector and government established

description.narrative: It is envisioned that through the systemic approach and through the multi stakeholder approach, the (vocational) education landscape in the focus countries changes

comment.narrative: Number of sustainable partnerships between training providers, private sector and government established

Partnerships include; government MoU with Dokolo district, 2 MoUs with the TVETs 9Kangai and Adwoki) , 3 MoUs with the private sector companies (Traford Co. Ltd dealers in soybean, Tropical Dynasty Co. Ltd dealers in G.nuts and Ngetta Tropical Holding Co . Ltd dealers in sun flower). The private sector partners provide market led production training, access to quality seeds, guaranteed markets and general extension advices on farmers’ production practices so that they meet required market demands

description.narrative: Education providers are supported in conducting a labour market analysis, identify most market relevant vocations and link with potential employers for internships or job placements. Support could consist of 7-steps to WORK training provided to TVET trainers.

title.narrative: Sustainable livelihoods and active citizenship through development of knowledge, skills and attitudes of marginalized children and youth

description.narrative: Sustainable livelihoods and active citizenship through development of knowledge, skills and attitudes of marginalized children and youth

title.narrative: % of all children reached that have a sustainable livelihood and demonstrate active citizenship

description.narrative: Edukans wants children to develop a sustainable livelihood and become active citizens. This is achieved through quality basic and secondary education. With the educational background children are empowered to successfully participate in society, both economically and socially. This indicator measures the percentage of all children reached by Edukans that have a sustainable livelihood and demonstrate active citizenship.

title.narrative: % of all youth reached that have a sustainable livelihood and demonstrate active citizenship

description.narrative: Edukans wants marginalised youth to develop a sustainable livelihood and become active citizens. This is achieved through vocational (technical) training and in some cases Life skills training. The training helps youngsters to be professional in obtaining and keeping a job or start their own business and to successfully participate in society, both economically and socially. This indicator measures the percentage of all youth reached by Edukans that have a sustainable livelihood and demonstrate active citizenship.

title.narrative: Teachers apply proven and effective teaching methods and materials and use relevant curricula

description.narrative: Teachers apply proven and effective teaching methods and materials and use relevant curricula

title.narrative: Number of teachers applying newly acquired teaching methods effectively

description.narrative: Teachers are observed to use active learning and effective instruction methods in their lessons. In addition they are observed to apply specific teaching skills and appropriate methods for SEL and CSE and apply these skills in their classrooms. Also, they use the proposed curricula from Edukans.
